title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON — On a night when the rim must have looked as wide as the Potomac, Houston Rockets guard Clyde Drexler authored a performance for the ages, carrying his team to a grueling 103-99 victory over the Washington Bullets.

From the opening tip, this was the Clyde Drexler show. The future Hall of Famer was simply unguardable, pouring in a breathtaking **41 points**. He attacked the basket with his trademark grace and punished the Bullets from the perimeter, finishing the night with a remarkable 6 three-pointers. Drexler’s historic output wasn't just about scoring; he filled the sheet with **9 rebounds, 6 assists, and 5 steals**, a stat line that underscored his complete dominance on both ends of the floor.

While Drexler was the undeniable engine of the victory, he received crucial support from the Rockets’ twin towers. Hakeem Olajuwon, though limited by foul trouble, was a force when on the court, recording a **16-point, 13-rebound double-double**. Charles Barkley added **19 points and 14 rebounds**, providing the muscle inside to help secure the win.

The Bullets, led by Chris Webber’s **22 points and 12 rebounds** and Juwan Howard’s **18 points**, fought valiantly. They traded blows with the Rockets throughout the second half, but every time Washington threatened to seize momentum, Drexler had an answer—a silky jumper, a drive through the lane, or a game-changing steal.

In the end, the story was not about the final score, but about the man who forged it. Clyde Drexler’s magnificent 41-point masterpiece was more than just a winning effort; it was a legendary display of skill and will that left the Capital Centre crowd in awe.
